title: 'Flimsy for the cost'
body: 'A good Nilkamal chair is ₹600. This has metal frames and plastic seating and backrest; it should be way more sturdy and comfortable for this money. Disappointed!'

title: 'Could have improved'
body: 'This is a gòod product. The only issue i find is the misbalance of the chair after assembling. Though its steady when you sit on it it misbalances when you stand up. Thats the only issue i find in the product.'

title: 'Missing part'
body: One part is missing..... can't assemble the chair....

title: 'Quite Comfortable'
body: 'It turns out to be quite comfortable chair. However after assembling one chair leg seemed to be shorter than the other causing a slight disturbance in the overall balance.'

title: 'A good product
rating: let down by a careless reseller.'
body: '4.0 out of 5 stars'This is a good chair and meets expectations adequately. The chair is listed on IKEA website for 500 Rs but we pay a bit more than double here as IKEA doesn't yet deliver all over India. I took this into consideration while ordering. The delivery was fuss free as expected from Amazon but the reseller has messed up a bit. One of the chairs has bushes for only 3 out of 4 legs and it makes a rocking annoying noise and is very likely to scratch the tiles.

title: 'Good product but bad packaging'
body: 'The chair is of very good quality but packaging was horrible! One of the chair rod went missing because it fell off the box and the box was all opened'

title: 'Good looking
body: '5.0 out of 5 stars'Good looking, Durable and comfortable, Light weighted because of which it may look less sturdy, But it's extremely worth in this price range
